Crimes.Legal_Issue: Can a deportation order be nullified retroactively due to subsequent acquittal?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant was convicted of mischief, deported, and later acquitted. Judicial review sought after 15-day deadline.
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application for extension of time and judicial review dismissed
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Nullification of deportation order and extension of time for judicial review
Crimes.Court_Ruling: Deportation order remains valid as it was lawful when issued
Crimes.Claimant_Status: Permanent resident or foreign national subject to deportation
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Pled guilty to mischief, later acquitted on appeal
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Deportation orders valid if based on lawful conviction at time of issuance
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Timeliness of application for judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Late filing of judicial review without adequate explanation for delay
Crimes.Review_Standard: Reasonableness and timeliness under administrative law principles
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not explicitly assessed; focus on procedural delay
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Conviction record, acquittal decision, court filings
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to criminal inadmissibility and deportation
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Timing and validity of conviction and acquittal
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Quashing of deportation order and retroactive legal remedy
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Deportation orders stand if legally grounded at time of issue
Crimes.Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to justify delay in filing judicial review
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Continued enforcement of deportation despite acquittal
Crimes.Cause_Description: Deportation triggered by conviction later overturned on appeal
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Acquittal recognized but not retroactively invalidating deportation
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; original deportation compliant with IRPA
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Conviction was valid at time of deportation
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: Legality of deportation determined at time of issuance, not affected by later acquittal
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Canada Border Services Agency / Immigration Division
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of justification for late judicial review application
Crimes.Legal_Standard_Applied: Administrative law standard for extensions of time and judicial review

Crimes.Victim_Status: Property owner or entity affected by mischief
Crimes.Aggravating_Factors: Plea of guilt indicating admission of wrongdoing
Crimes.Mitigating_Factors: Later acquittal on appeal based on legal grounds
Crimes.Criminality_Severity: Summary conviction offence, non-violent but criminally sanctionable
Crimes.Evidence_Sufficiency: Sufficient for initial conviction, later challenged successfully
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Court records, plea agreement, appellate decision
Crimes.Evidence_Credibility: Initially accepted; later re-evaluated on appeal
Crimes.Risk_Assessment: Low public safety risk, but deemed inadmissible under immigration law
Crimes.Risk_Type: Legal risk due to immigration consequences of criminal record
Crimes.Risk_Nature: Administrative immigration consequence rather than public danger
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Provincial criminal jurisdiction, federal immigration consequences
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Initial conviction entered, later overturned on appeal
Crimes.Outcome: Acquittal on appeal, but no retroactive effect on deportation
Crimes.Sentencing_Issue: Sentence led to immigration consequences including deportation
Crimes.Procedural_Issues: Delay in seeking judicial review of deportation order
Crimes.Legal_Procedure: Judicial review under Federal Court Rules
Crimes.Decision_Maker: Provincial court (conviction), Appellate court (acquittal), Federal Court (immigration review)
Crimes.Government_Body_Involved: Canada Border Services Agency, Federal Court
Crimes.Review_Mechanism: Judicial review of administrative immigration decision
Crimes.Decision_Standard: Reasonableness and timeliness of legal challenges
